title: Nature and Stress: Attention Restoration Theory
description: Learn Nature and Stress: Attention Restoration Theory in one minute.

hook.text: A 20-minute walk in a park reduces cortisol by 20%. The same walk on a busy street? Almost no effect.

buildup.text: Kaplan's Attention Restoration Theory: natural environments restore depleted attention in ways urban settings cannot.

discovery.text: Nature provides 'soft fascination' â€” engaging enough to hold attention but not demanding enough to drain it.

twist.text: Even viewing nature through a window or looking at nature photos provides measurable stress reduction.

climax.text: No forest nearby? Desk plants, nature sounds, and lunch outside all provide partial restoration.

punchline.text: Nature doesn't just feel good. It literally restores your brain's capacity.

quiz.question: What does Attention Restoration Theory say about nature?
options: Natural environments restore depleted attention better than urban settings
